org.jtrim2.taskgraph

Interface TaskInputRef<I>

  • Type Parameters:
    I - the type of the input

    public interface TaskInputRef<I>
    Defines a reference to the input of a task node. The task node might read its input in its task node action.

    Note: The executor may decide that it will execute task node again. In this case, the action may request its input again. However, each action call may consume the input at most once.

    Thread safety

    The method of this interface may not be accessed concurrently by multiple threads. This is also implied that it is not allowed to call consumeInput multiple times.

    Synchronization transparency

    The method of this interface is not synchronization transparent and may only be called from the action of a task node.
    See Also:
    TaskInputBinder

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      I consumeInput()
      Returns the input bound when creating the task node.

    • Method Detail

      • consumeInput

        I consumeInput()
        Returns the input bound when creating the task node. This method may not be called multiple times by the same task action call. Attempting to do so is considered an error. This behaviour allows preventing unneeded memory retention.
        Returns:
        the input bound when creating the task node. This method may return null, if the dependency node action returned null.
